thread.title: BJP Wins Someshwara TMC: Bjp Wins Someshwara Tmc; Bags 16 Of 23 Seats | Mangaluru News - Times of India
thread.title_full: BJP Wins Someshwara TMC: Bjp Wins Someshwara Tmc; Bags 16 Of 23 Seats | Mangaluru News - Times of India

author: TNN
title: BJP Wins Someshwara TMC: Bjp Wins Someshwara Tmc; Bags 16 Of 23 Seats | Mangaluru News - Times of India
text: Mangaluru: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) registered a thumping victory in the Someshwara Town Municipal Council (TMC), by winning 16 out of 23 seats in the elections held to the town municipality council.The Congress won seven seats. This was the first election held for the Someshwara TMC after it was upgraded from a gram panchayat. The Congress had fielded its candidate in 22 seats, and in one ward, the party had extended support to the CPM candidate. There were 50 candidates in fray in the election. In the Kumpala ward, Congress candidate Deepak Pilar and BJP candidate Rajesh Kumar KS had secured an equal vote of 247. The Congress candidate was declared the winner after drawing a lot. A couple had contested from the first and second ward on Congress tickets. While Ameena Basheer won against BJP candidate Sunitha Rajesh from the first ward in Mundoli, her husband Basheer, who contested from the second ward, lost to BJP candidate Yashwanth, with a narrow margin of one vote. Puttur byelectionIn the byelection held for two seats in Puttur city municipal council (CMC), the Congress and BJP have won one seat each. Candidates backed by the Puthila Pariwara organisation had to face defeat in both seats. In ward number one, Congress candidate Dinesh Shevire won against Puthila Pariwara backed candidate Annapoorna. BJP candidate Sunitha was pushed to the third place in the election. In ward number 11, Ramesh Rai won against Congress candidate Damodar Bhandarkar. The election to the Someshwara TMC and in two seats of Puttur CMC was held on December 27. We also published the following articles recentlyPMML, a party backed by Hafiz Saeed, fields candidates in Pak electionsA new political front organisation, Pakistan Markazi Muslim League (PMML), set up by Hafiz Saeed, has fielded candidates for the upcoming general elections in Pakistan. Saeed, the founder of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and mastermind of the 26/11 terror attacks, has been in jail since 2019. PMML aims to come to power and make Pakistan an Islamic welfare state. PMML President Khalid Masood Sindhu confirmed that his party is contesting on most of the national and provincial assembly seats. Talha Saeed, Hafiz Saeed's son, is also contesting as a candidate from Lahore's NA-127 constituency.106268440Ahead of polls, BJP candidate takes oath as minister in RajasthanRajasthan CM Bhajanlal Sharma forms cabinet with 22 ministers taking oath at Raj Bhavan in Jaipur. Notable inclusion of Sawai Madhopur MLA Kirori Lal Meena, Jhotwara MLA Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore, and Surendra Pal Singh TT, BJP candidate for Karanpur assembly seat. Congress accuses BJP of violating model code of conduct, plans to file complaint with ED. BJP dismisses accusations. Council of ministers does not include any Muslim members.106409558Time running out for Congress to seal deal on West Bengal seats: TMCBengal CM Mamata Banerjee's TMC shows impatience over seat-sharing with Congress in Bengal. TMC offered two seats to Congress based on previous polls. Mamata insists TMC will fight BJP in Bengal and teach a lesson. Congress needs to prove they are not BJP's 'B-team'. Mamata suggests Akhilesh Yadav and Arvind Kejriwal lead fights in UP, Delhi, and Punjab.106389025
